e4: Switching to an unbiased reporting policy bolsters the company’s integrity and authenticity in financial disclosures, making it more aligned with regulatory expectations and minimizing potential lawsuits risk related to misinformation. Despite transitional interpretation challenges among some investors, offering better transparency projects trustworthiness, benefiting long-term relationships with existing and prospective shareholders.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should provide accurate, unbiased financial reports that reflect true performance, fostering transparency and trust. It must ensure consistency, abide by regulations, avoid deliberately misleading biases, and prioritize equitable treatment of all shareholders regardless of their sophistication level. Additionally, clear, forthright communications around any policy shift should protect less-informed investors while maintaining corporate integrity.
e6: Yes, I would ask management how they plan to communicate the policy change effectively to all investors, particularly retail investors. I would also follow up on strategies to ensure that the change minimizes initial confusion and prevents unintended stock market reactions, as well as further risk assessment on potential benefits and detractors coming forth.
